intro: Ludwigia sericea, commonly known as silky Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its finely hairy, silvery leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It is often grown as an ornamental plant in water gardens and aquariums due to its attractive foliage. Ludwigia sericea prefers warm, humid conditions and is commonly found in wetlands and streamside habitats.
